result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony Darnell Hill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).
  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, assessments, fees and surcharges, DNA surcharge as a condition of probation imposed in Count 5 and failure to do so will result in a civil judgment.

Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 03/11/2016 @ 1:15pm
Probation review hearing May 13, 2016 at 1:30 in Branch 45.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA surcharge, pay costs and DNA surcharge. Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by DOC's. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. The court orders that all costs, assessments and surcharges imposed in Count 4 are to be paid in this period of probation or civil judgment to be entered.
- No contact with firearms. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

IF ANY VIOLATIONS THE DEFENDANT SHOULD BE REVOKED.
- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
- Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/ Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Parenting classes.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with children under the age of 18 years.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

records.addlTxt: Printed in error,  no changes.
Count five.  Per Order for Commitment  signed/entry of 5/13/2016.

Defendant Tony Darnell Hill in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 3 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.
Per email from Probation Agent, case adjourned to 5-13-2016 at 1:30 pm for probation review hearing in Branch 45.
Count five.
Count four.

Defendant Tony Darnell Hill in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Tony Darnell Hill in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
AS to count 4:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 133 days time served.  Court orders the defendant to pay all costs, assessments, fees and surcharges, DNA surcharge as a condition of probation imposed in Count 5 and failure to do so will result in civil judgment.
AS to count 5:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 26 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 13 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 13 MONTHS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.  
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 120 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 3-11-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
IF ANY VIOLATIONS THE DEFENDANT SHOULD BE REVOKED.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with children under that age of 18 years.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. The court orders that all costs, assessments and surcharges imposed in count 4 are to be paid in this period of probation or civil judgment to be entered.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-Restitution is set at 0.
Defendant given firearm admonition and voting prohibition at plea hearing(8-24-2015).
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation; Impact Statement; Ineligible Voting Notice.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Tony Darnell Hill in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Tony Darnell Hill in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties were prepared to proceed to trial.  State was concerned that defense counsel had had reviewed all three of the forensic videos of the children.  Parties had stipulated to the use of the videos.  Defense counsel will review the third video this afternoon.  Motions in Limine, both state and defense are stipulated to.  The court will allow prior juvenile adjudications to be presented to the jury.  The state will not be using any of the evidence as to co-defendants.  State's offer is placed on the record and rejected by the defendant.  The court orders sequestration of witnesses.
Prior to the jury being brought into the courtroom, the defendant changed his mind and wishes to accept the offer from the state.
On motion of the State, Court ordered counts 4 and 5 amended to  Physical Abuse of a Child-RECKLESS Causation, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(3)(b) , a Class I felony and will delete the repeater enhancer.
As to each of the amended charges:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty of amended charges and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Defendant remanded pending sentencing on 9-24-2015 at 8:15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Received and Filed, Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions.
Received and Filed, Defendant's Witness List.

Defendant Tony Darnell Hill in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Tony Darnell Hill in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
In chambers discussion held.  Case called.  Matter is set for speedy trial today, however, Atty Voss has another speedy trial in another court.  Defendant will not consent to an extension of speedy trial time limit(August 22, 2015- a Saturday).
Court will adjourn trial to 8-24-2015 at 8:15 for trial.  Court informs parties that court is not in session the afternoon of the 24th.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Motion In Limine (Prior Violent Acts) filed by Atty. Richard L. Voss.
Defendant's Motion In Limine (Witness Intimidation) filed by Atty. Richard L. Voss.
General Motion In Limine filed by Atty. Richard L. Voss.
Defendant's Motion In Limine (Allegations of Child Regarding U.A. Tests) filed by Atty. Richard L. Voss.
Defendant's Motion In Limine (Prior Juvenile Adjudications) filed by Atty. Richard L. Voss.
dated 7-20-2015, addressed to the court from Attorney Richard L. Voss, received and filed.   mld
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Absolutely No Release from Home (24 hour curfew).   mld

Defendant Tony Darnell Hill in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Tony Darnell Hill in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and granted by the Court.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 8-3-2015 at 8:15 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with co-defendants, or KR or KMR, until further order of the Court.   mld
for Modification of Bail from defense, received and filed.   mld
NOTICE TO OFFER VIDEO-RECORDED INTERVIEWS OF CHILDREN AT TRIAL.
STATE'S.
TO ADMIT VIDEOTAPED STATEMENT IN THE INTERESTS OF JUSTICE UNDER 908.08.
STATE'S REQUESTED JURY INSTRUCTIONS.
NOTICE OF EXPERT TESTIMONY.

Attorney Richard L. Voss appeared in court for defendant, Tony Darnell Hill.  Defendant, Tony Darnell Hill not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The following co-defendant cases were called simultaneously: Cases 2015CF2207, 2015CF2208 and 2015CF2209.    
DEMAND for Speedy Trial was entered on 5-22-2015 for case 2015CF2208.   
Upon the motion of the State, with no objection by counsel, Court ordered the following cases CONSOLIDATED for the purposes of trial: Cases 2015CF2207, 2015CF2208 and 2015CF2209.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference g in Branch 4 on 7-28-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 8-3-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  Court vacates the Pretrial Conference date of 6-25-2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 4.   mld
to Adjourn Speedy Trial, from the State, received and filed.   mld

dated 5-27-2015, addressed from the Court to from Attorney Richard Voss, received and filed.  
-- To notify that defense counsel has mailed a Discovery Demand to the State.   mld

Defendant Tony Darnell Hill in court with attorney RIchard Voss. Defendant Darnell Hill, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for Abbey DeSiato for the State of Wisconsin.  
This is a co-defendant case with case 2015CF2207.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Andrew Kempen.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss heard  and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Paper discovery received by defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-25-2015 at 830 am and Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 8-17-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Branch 38, Judge Jeffrey Wagner, in Room 504 of the Courthouse.   mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: KR (6/9/01); KMR (9/7/04); Co-Defendants: Shirley Hill; Melvin Malone.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tony Darnell Hill in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Tony Darnell Hill in custody.  
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Assistant District Attorney requested an  Early Preliminary Hearing date,  No objection from the Public Defender Attorney.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
